data.title: Report: Free agent Carlos Boozer still in conversations with Mavericks, three other teams
data.meta_description: Report: Free agent Carlos Boozer still in conversations with Mavericks, three other teams
data.text:
Free agent Carlos Boozer is in on-going conversations with four teams, including the Dallas Mavericks, according to ESPN.com's Chris Broussard. The others: Los Angeles Clippers, San Antonio Spurs and Toronto Raptors.

Boozer would likely have to choose the Mavericks for the league minimum. A sign-and-trade, possibly involving Raymond Felton, could provide the space. Dallas is expected to use their $2.8 million exception, the only one they have left, on point guard J.J. Barea. The Mavericks could also target guard Jeremy Lin.

Advertisement

Boozer's 11.9 points and 6.8 rebounds per-game average represented his lowest marks since his rookie year in the 2002-03 season.

Advertisement

According to the LA Daily News, the two-time All-Star and Olympic gold medalist lost his starting job less than two months into the season amid concerns about his defense. He experienced a string of bench sittings so the Lakers could develop younger talent.

Mavericks

But the Lakers were impressed with Boozer's enthusiasm, cheering from the bench and high-fiving teammates on the court.
